description:
11.213 rotate
Rotate video by an arbitrary angle expressed in radians.

The filter accepts the following options:

A description of the optional parameters follows.

The expressions for the angle and the output size can contain the
following constants and functions:
name: rotate

options.description:
Set an expression for the angle by which to rotate the input video clockwise, expressed as a number of radians. A negative value will result in a counter-clockwise rotation. By default it is set to "0".

This expression is evaluated for each frame.
options.name: angle

options.description: Set the output width expression, default value is "iw". This expression is evaluated just once during configuration.
options.name: out_w

options.description: Set the output height expression, default value is "ih". This expression is evaluated just once during configuration.
options.name: out_h

options.description:
Set the color used to fill the output area not covered by the rotated image. For the general syntax of this option, check the (ffmpeg-utils)"Color" section in the ffmpeg-utils manual. If the special value "none" is selected then no background is printed (useful for example if the background is never shown).

Default value is "black".
options.name: fillcolor

options.description: Enable bilinear interpolation if set to 1, a value of 0 disables it. Default value is 1.
options.name: bilinear
